He is also the Chief Product Officer of our Company and heads the product research and development of our Company. He is one of the founders and Promoters of our Company. He holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in commerce from University of Mumbai. He has experience in technology, product research and development. He also co-founded Redwood Interactive which owned ‚ÄòRedGear‚Äô, a gaming brand in India. Aman Gupta Whole Time Director & Chief Marketing Officer Learn More √ó Aman Gupta Whole Time Director & Chief Marketing Officer Aman is the co-founder and chief marketing officer of an earwear audio company called boAt. This company has a string of products that include but aren't limited to headphones and travel chargers. 2016 saw Aman founding this company along with Sameer Mehta who is his business partner. Vivek Gambhir Non-Executive Director, Chairman Learn More √ó Vivek Gambhir Non-Executive Director, Chairman Vivek Gambhir is the Non-Executive Director of our Company. He holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in science (computer science), a bachelor‚Äôs degree in arts (economics and business) from Lafayette College, Easton, Pennsylvania and a master‚Äôs degree in business administration from Harvard Business School, Boston, Massachusetts. He was the chief executive officer and managing director of Godrej Consumer Products Limited and the chief strategy officer of Godrej Industries Limited. He was associated with Bain & Company India Private Limited as a partner and was a founding member of Bain & Company‚Äôs consulting operations in India. He has previously been the co-chair of the Confederation of Indian Industry, National FMCG Committee and served as the president of the Harvard Business School Club of India. He is currently on the advisory board of the Central Square Foundation and authors a leadership blog, www.monday-8am.com. Anish Saraf Non-Executive Director Learn More √ó Anish Saraf Non-Executive Director Anish Saraf is a Non-Executive Director of our Company. He holds a post-graduate diploma in management from the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad and is a qualified chartered accountant with the Institute of 185Chartered Accountants of India. He is associated with Warburg Pincus India Private Limited since 2006 where he currently holds the position of managing director. Purvi Sheth Non-Executive Independent Director Learn More √ó Purvi Sheth Non-Executive Independent Director Purvi Sheth is an Independent Director of our Company. She has passed the bachelor of arts degree examination (economics and political science) from St. Xavier‚Äôs College, Mumbai, University of Mumbai and has completed the certificate of professional development program from the Wharton Business School, University of Pennsylvania. She has been associated with the firm, Shilputsi Consultants, for more than 25 years where she currently holds the position of the chief executive officer. Aashish Kamat Non-Executive Independent Director Learn More √ó Aashish Kamat Non-Executive Independent Director Aashish Kamat is an Independent Director of our Company. He holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in arts from the Franklin and Marshall College and is a member of the Pennsylvania Institute of Certified Public Accountants. He was previously the managing director in corporate & investment bank department of JP Morgan Chase Bank, N.A, the chief financial officer and managing director of Bank of America (GCIB), chief executive officer of UBS AG, Mumbai Branch, India, managing director of UBS AG, Hong Kong Branch and managing director, chief operating officer of L Catterton Asia. Anand Ramamoorthy Non-Executive Independent Director Learn More √ó Anand Ramamoorthy Non-Executive Independent Director Anand Ramamoorthy is an Independent Director of our Company. He holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering (metallurgical engineering) from University of Roorkee, a master‚Äôs degree in mechanical engineering from Auburn University and a master‚Äôs degree in business administration from Santa Clara University. He currently serves as the vice-president, India country executive of Micron Technology Operations India LLP. He was previously associated with Marvell Semiconductors, Inc. as senior director of India business development, and McAfee Software India Private Limited as senior director, sales. Deven Waghani Non-Executive Independent Director Learn More √ó Deven Waghani Non-Executive Independent Director Deven Waghani is an Independent Director of our Company. He holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree of technology in chemical engineering from Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, and a master‚Äô degree in business administration from the University of Chicago. He also holds a post-graduate diploma in management from Indian Institute of Management, Calcutta. He was associated with McKinsey & Company as a senior engagement manager, Microsoft as senior director ‚Äì SBU strategy and business development, and Hewlett ‚Äì Packard as vice president ‚Äì strategy and planning. He also serves as the senior vice president ‚Äì business operations, for Automation Anywhere Inc. Back to top India's fastest growing audio & wearables brand. Craft Beer Enthusiast Sep 05, 2025 Table of Contents Tips 1: FAQ Table of Contents Tips 1 FAQ Free Smart Home Planner AI-Powered smart home design software 2025 Home Design for Free Flying Boat Tap Room LLC offers a unique brewpub experience for those looking to enjoy craft beer in an inspirational setting. Nestled in a welcoming neighborhood, Flying Boat Tap Room is more than just a place to sample locally brewed beers‚Äîit's a hub of community and creative gathering. Their rotating tap list features regional favorites and exclusive house brews, fostering a dynamic tasting experience for both connoisseurs and casual beer drinkers. The inviting interior design, characterized by an open floor plan, warm lighting, and locally inspired d√©cor, plays an essential role in promoting social interaction and comfort. The venue often hosts events, live music, and food pairings that further enhance the community feel, making it a destination for social gatherings and personal celebrations alike. Tips 1: As a designer, I believe that creating an immersive brewpub environment is about more than just serving great drinks‚Äîit's about curating meaningful experiences through thoughtful interior choices. By analyzing Flying Boat Tap Room's layout, lighting, and atmosphere, I recommend investing in professional tools such as a home designer platform to streamline layout planning and create cohesive, guest-friendly spaces. This approach not only improves traffic flow but also ensures the taproom‚Äôs character and concept shine through in every detail. FAQ Q: What makes the Flying Boat Tap Room experience unique? A: The combination of exclusive craft brews, community-centered events, and thoughtful interior design sets it apart from typical brewpubs. Q: Does Flying Boat Tap Room host private events? A: Yes, they often accommodate private parties and celebrations, utilizing their flexible event space. Q: Are there food options available at the tap room? A: The tap room frequently partners with local food vendors or features food trucks for curated pairings. Q: Can I tour the brewing process at Flying Boat Tap Room? A: Many times, the venue offers behind-the-scenes tours or hosts brewers for educational sessions. Q: How does interior design contribute to the taproom's atmosphere? A: Strategic design choices‚Äîsuch as open layouts and ambient lighting‚Äîpromote comfort and community, enhancing the overall guest experience.                         means of communication. A. What is cookie & Why do we use cookies When you visit Coohom Platform, the site asks your browser to store a small piece of data (text
                            file)
                            called

Marketing cookies collect personal information such as your IP address and clicks.                             Platform,

Flying Boats Brewing - ABOUT US Search this site Embedded Files Skip to main content Skip to navigation JOIN THE BOAT CLUB - DEVENEZ MEMBRE DU BOAT CLUB CLICK TO JOIN Flying Boats Brewing HOME THE BOAT CLUB ABOUT US OUR BEERS TAPROOM PRIVATE EVENTS CONTACT US Flying Boats Brewing HOME THE BOAT CLUB ABOUT US OUR BEERS TAPROOM PRIVATE EVENTS CONTACT US More HOME THE BOAT CLUB ABOUT US OUR BEERS TAPROOM PRIVATE EVENTS CONTACT US ABOUT US The ‚ÄúFlying Boats‚Äù moniker and beer names, in general, are a nod to the history of transportation in southeast New Brunswick, including its early aviation, railway, ships and boats, and highway travel. This part of NB has a unique and interesting history that will be celebrated with full-bodied and flavourful craft beers that will be tied to some of these stories. Flying Boats Brewing was an idea that started in the early 1990s when owner Marc Melanson returned from 10 years of working as an automotive engineer in several European countries. After an abundance of distinctive, regionally produced beers in Europe, returning to Canada was akin to stumbling upon an arid desert, with a lack of selection and variety to choose from. Hence started the process to see what North America could offer. The search for authentic locally produced craft beers was enjoyed during numerous business trips in the US and Canada. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Le surnom "Flying Boats" et les noms des bi√®res, en g√©n√©ral, rendent hommage √† l'histoire des transports dans le sud-est du Nouveau-Brunswick, y compris ses d√©buts dans l'aviation, les chemins de fer, les navires et bateaux, ainsi que les voyages par la route. Cette r√©gion du Nouveau-Brunswick poss√®de une histoire unique et int√©ressante qui sera c√©l√©br√©e √† travers des bi√®res artisanales riches en corps et en saveurs, li√©es √† certaines de ces histoires. Flying Boats Brewing √©tait une id√©e qui a commenc√© au d√©but des ann√©es 1990 lorsque le propri√©taire Marc Melanson est revenu apr√®s avoir travaill√© dix ans comme ing√©nieur automobile dans plusieurs pays europ√©ens. Apr√®s avoir d√©couvert une abondance de bi√®res distinctives produites localement en Europe, revenir au Canada √©tait comme se retrouver dans un d√©sert aride, avec un manque de choix et de vari√©t√© √† disposition. C'est ainsi qu'a commenc√© le processus pour d√©couvrir ce que l'Am√©rique du Nord pouvait offrir. La recherche de bi√®res artisanales authentiques produites localement a √©t√© appr√©ci√©e lors de nombreux voyages d'affaires aux √âtats-Unis et au Canada. Over the years, more and more selection of locally produced craft beers appeared on the market as well as new beer styles that emerged for different tastes. This coincided with the desire to channel his drive and passion into creating fresh locally produced ‚Äì Maritime inspired craft beers. When a buddy said, ‚ÄúYou should offer this to the public‚Äù ‚Äì the gears started to turn and the long days and countless hours to create great tasting craft beers started and the passion has been driving the perfection of locally produced craft beer ever since. Flying Boat Brewing started in our garage in June 2015 and was licensed under a 2 BBL system, after several years of home brewing and developing new recipes. We expanded to a new 15 Barrel Brewhouse in January 2018, with a small canning line, and a fully licenced Taproom, offering beer flight samples, pints, plus growler fills and 473 mL cans to go. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Au fil des ann√©es, de plus en plus de choix de bi√®res artisanales produites localement ont fait leur apparition sur le march√©, ainsi que de nouveaux styles de bi√®res adapt√©s √† diff√©rents go√ªts. Cela a co√Øncid√© avec le d√©sir de canaliser son dynamisme et sa passion dans la cr√©ation de bi√®res artisanales inspir√©es par les Maritimes, fra√Æchement produites localement. Lorsqu'un ami a dit : "Tu devrais proposer √ßa au public", les rouages ont commenc√© √† tourner et les longues journ√©es et les heures innombrables pour cr√©er des bi√®res artisanales au go√ªt exceptionnel ont commenc√©, et la passion continue de perfectionner la bi√®re artisanale produite localement depuis lors. Flying Boat Brewing a d√©but√© dans notre garage en juin 2015 et a obtenu une licence pour un syst√®me de 2 barils (BBL), apr√®s plusieurs ann√©es de brassage amateur et de d√©veloppement de nouvelles recettes. Nous avons d√©m√©nag√© vers une nouvelle brasserie de 15 barils en janvier 2018, avec une petite ligne de mise en canettes, et un bar √† bi√®res enti√®rement licenci√©, proposant des √©chantillons de d√©gustation, des pintes, ainsi que des remplissages de growlers et des canettes de 473 mL √† emporter. +1 (506) 857-0537 info@flyingboatsbrewing.com 700 Malenfant Blvd Dieppe NB, Canada E1A 5V8 Google Sites Report abuse Page details Page updated Google Sites Report abuse

Explore the Unique Charm of Flying Boat Tap Room LLC Empresa Plataforma abierta Iniciar sesi√≥n Empieza gratis Productos Planificador de piso Dise√±o de interiores Dise√±o de cocinas y armarios Dise√±o de viviendas con IA Estudio fotogr√°fico Visor 3D Modelos 3D Biblioteca de modelos Subir modelos de marca Modelado 3D Recursos Ideas de dise√±o para el hogar Tutorial Centro de ayuda Art√≠culo Aplicaci√≥n Coohom Precios Negocio Prueba gratuita para empresas Afiliado Programa de socios Socio indio Filial Educaci√≥n Iniciar sesi√≥n Art√≠culos / Free home design / home design software Exploring the Unique Charm of Flying Boat Tap Room LLC : A Dive into Craft Beer and Community at the Flying Boat Tap Room Ethan Brooks Sep 05, 2025 √çndice Tips 1: FAQ √çndice Tips 1 FAQ Planificador de casas inteligentes gratuito Software de dise√±o de casas inteligentes con IA (2025) Dise√±o de hogar gratis Flying Boat Tap Room LLC has quickly become a local favorite, celebrated for its vibrant atmosphere, unique heritage, and innovative beer offerings. Located in St. Petersburg, Florida, the tap room draws inspiration from the city‚Äôs aviation history‚Äîspecifically, the legendary Benoist flying boat, which completed the world‚Äôs first scheduled commercial airline flight in 1914. Step inside, and you‚Äôre greeted by an artfully curated interior: subtle aviation motifs, industrial-chic exposed brick, and vintage propeller replicas lend a nod to days past while keeping the space lively and modern. The tap room stands out for its thoughtful selection of craft beers, favoring both local microbreweries and specialty imports. Beer flights cater to the adventurous, while knowledgeable staff guide newcomers on a curated tasting journey. Community tables, ample natural light, and adaptive lounge areas make it an ideal space for informal gatherings or solo reflection. Regular events‚Äîfrom trivia nights to live acoustic sessions‚Äîfoster a sense of belonging that‚Äôs rare in larger venues. As a designer, I‚Äôm always drawn to spaces that tell a story through their layout and d√©cor. Flying Boat Tap Room LLC succeeds by blending historical tribute with contemporary comfort. The way seating zones are organized encourages both mingling and privacy, while the thematic details provide endless inspiration. For those interested in reimagining their own social space or home bar, exploring modern tap room aesthetics and layout principles can spark creative ideas. You might find it worthwhile to delve into professional-grade room planner tools that help visualize seating arrangements and traffic flow, bringing together both style and functionality. Tips 1: When designing a gathering space, balance open layouts with cozy corners. Flexible furniture and layered lighting can help achieve a welcoming but dynamic environment‚Äîsomething Flying Boat Tap Room LLC does exceptionally well. FAQ Q: What makes Flying Boat Tap Room LLC unique among St. Petersburg bars? A: Its aviation-inspired decor, diverse craft beer list, and vibrant community events distinguish it from typical venues. Q: Does the tap room offer food alongside their beer selection? A: While primarily focused on beverages, they often host food trucks and local pop-up kitchens, so options are regularly available. Q: Can I host a private event at Flying Boat Tap Room LLC? A: Yes, private parties and events are welcome; contact the venue for specific arrangements and availability. Q: Is the tap room family-friendly? A: Most events and times are family-friendly, but check for age-specific events before visiting. Q: How does design influence the tap room‚Äôs atmosphere? A: A thoughtful blend of historical touches and modern layout creates an inviting, memorable environment for guests. Designers often look to such spaces for inspiration on functional yet thematic interiors. Home Design for Free Please check with customer service before testing new feature.                         means of communication. A. What is cookie & Why do we use cookies When you visit Coohom Platform, the site asks your browser to store a small piece of data (text
                            file)
                            called
                            a cookie on your device in order to evaluate the performance of the site. We also use
                            third-party
                            cookies,
                            which are cookies from a domain different than the domain of Coohom Platform you are visiting,
                            for
                            marketing
                            efforts. B. What kind of cookies do we use We use the following categories of cookies: 1. Strictly necessary cookies Strictly necessary cookies are necessary for Coohom Platform to function and cannot be switched
                            off in
                            our
                            systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request
                            for
                            services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set
                            your
                            browser
                            to block or alert you about these cookies, but that will cause some parts of Coohom Platform to
                            not
                            work. 2. Performance cookies Performance cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve
                            the
                            performance of our site.They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see
                            how
                            visitors
                            move around the site.If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited
                            our site
                            and
                            will not be able to monitor its performance. 3. Marketing cookies We also cooperate with third-parties that deploy cookies when users interact with marketing communications. Marketing cookies collect personal information such as your IP address and clicks. Collected information is used to evaluate the effectiveness of our marketing campaigns or to provide better targeting for marketing. We do not always have control over those cookies. C. How do I control and delete cookies 1. Cookie settings The " Cookie Settings " can be

                            usually

                            cookie

                            through your

                            collected prior

                            collect any

                            Platform to not work. You can accept or refuse the use of performance cookies or marketing cookies at any time. If you

                            Platform,

                            to make

                            our use

                            updated. F. Where can I get further information If you have any questions about our use of cookies, please feel free to contact us via email at

After graduating from Connecticut College in 2015, she started at Merrill Lynch in private wealth management. Cecily came back to CRBC full time in 2017 and has been loving planning events and working on board the six different boats ever since. Her favorite part about the job is working with clients to plan their events and watching them come to life alongside our amazing crew. When Cecily is not working, she loves spending time on the water with her husband, Ben, skiing, and playing pickleball with her friends. She is on the board of her high school, Holderness School, and is heavily involved with the Vincent Club, which supports Women‚Äôs Health at MGH. Gibson Cushman Director of Operations / Owner From a young age you could find Gibson crawling around the boats with his dad. His passion for boats and spending time on the water only continued to grow so it was no surprise that he got his 100 Ton Master Captain‚Äôs License as soon as he was eligible. One of Gibson‚Äôs favorite aspects of his job is working within a close-knit team environment, where everyone works together towards a common goal. He takes great pride in his work and enjoys sharing his knowledge and experience with his colleagues. Gibson has cruised on different boats all around the world but is happiest cruising the local waters around Boston. When Gibson isn‚Äôt on the water, you can find him spending time with his beloved puppy, Wallace. Gibson also loves to be outdoors, whether fishing, flying, skiing or hiking he is always up for an adventure! Russell Cushman Founder / Owner Russell founded the Charles River Boat Company in 1990 with his new bride Eliza. He had previously been the General Manager of the Seaport Cruise Line in New York City and the Spirit of Boston. Taking a pleasure boat trip on the Charles River in 1989, he was awed by the beauty and history of the Charles River and set out to start his own company. Today, the company has grown to six boats and has become a true family business. ‚ÄúI feel very grateful that we have had such great community and family support.‚Äù Eliza Cushman Founder / Florist Eliza helped Russell start the Charles River Boat Company in July 1990, the same summer they were married. With a background in retail management, Eliza started in charter sales building friendships with returning clients. After 3 years in sales, she stepped out to raise three children and volunteer her time with schools, church and Children‚Äôs Hospital fundraising. In recent years, Eliza has returned to lead our floral design team, and creates beautiful flower arrangements on all of the boats! Office Operations Kelley Bresnahan Controller Kelley has worked for Charles River Boat Company since graduating from Salem State College with a degree in Business Administration in 1995. She began in the Sales Department before moving into her current position of Controller. She is proud of being involved with the growth of the company in the many years she has worked for CRBC. Kelley is in charge of many of the business aspects of the company including Financial and Human Resources. Although her position is behind the scenes, Kelley enjoys interacting with clients while seeing off the cruises. While her children were in school, Kelley was highly involved with volunteering in the public schools within her city. Kelley‚Äôs favorite thing is spending time with her husband David and children Kyra, Meeghan and Dillon. Ella Stahl Office Operations & Human Resources Assistant Growing up on Long Island, Ella learned how to cast a fishing pole almost before she learned to walk. With a captain for a dad, she spent most of her childhood on the water, picking up all the little things that come with growing up around boats. She studied at the University of Rhode Island, where she learned to sail and developed her love for New England. During college, Ella began working at a catering hall, where she quickly found her passion for events and operations. With over four years of experience in the hospitality industry, her favorite part continues to be the people‚Äîshe believes hospitality brings together the hardest-working and friendliest individuals, creating a melting pot of unforgettable experiences and lasting connections. Ella is thrilled to bring together her background on the water and her love of events in her role at Charles River Boat Company. Outside of work, you can find her at a live music show, cheering on a hockey game, or discovering the newest food and drink spots around town. Sales & Events Melissa Otis Director of Sales Melissa joined the Charles River Boat Company team back in 2013 the summer after graduating from Boston University. What was planned to be a quick Summer job, turned into an unbelievable love of boating and a constantly growing passion for sales and events! Her favorite parts of working in events is building relationships with clients and seeing their visions come to life. She also loves training and motivating the dynamic sales team to provide the best customer experience possible! Outside of the office you will find Melissa at the beach, kayaking, hiking or planning her next travel adventure! Dayna Linehan Assistant Director of Sales With her background in musical theatre, Dayna always knew she wanted to create amazing experiences. It wasn‚Äôt until she started planning her own wedding that she realized events were just like putting on a show. When you hit the right mix of emotion, design and personal touch, the magic happens! This connection mixed with her extensive background in bar management in both New York City and Los Angeles led her to finding her place in the event industry here in Boston. Working for a catering company allowed her to hone in on her food and beverage knowledge and she is now thrilled to put this to use with events out on the water. While weddings are how she started, Dayna loves any reason to party. There is nothing better than celebrating something special with great food, amazing drinks and a busy dancefloor! Onboard, she loves to take in both views of the celebration and the incredible Boston skyline! Dayna loves spending time laughing with her husband and son, checking out a great concert and exploring the world one road trip at a time! Georgie Head Senior Marketing & Sales Manager Georgie started planning and coordinating weddings and events back in 2018. After graduating with a degree in Managing for Sustainability from McGill University in Montreal, she moved to Boston and joined our team in 2021. Georgie has loved weddings for as long as she can remember! While she might shed a few tears watching your ceremony onboard, her actual favorite part of the wedding day is watching the couple, surrounded by their loved ones, let loose and enjoy the day that they have been planning for months‚Ä¶ and of course when the dance floor opens! Georgie loves spending all her time by the water. When she‚Äôs not at the beach or the lake, she can be found reading, crafting and singing Broadway songs to anyone who will listen! Jane Severin Event Sales & Partnerships Manager Jane joined the Charles River Boat Company team in May 2024 after graduating from the University of Connecticut with a degree in Communications. During college, she gained valuable event planning experience by organizing formals, philanthropy events, and more, which helped her discover and refine her passion for the industry. Jane loves connecting with clients and making their special day everything they had hoped for! When she isn‚Äôt on the boats or in the office, Jane enjoys taking her dogs to the beach, reading, and spending time with friends and family. Olivia Leete Sales & Event Manager After earning her Communications Degree from Florida State University, Olivia decided to trade the Florida sunshine for the vibrant energy of Boston. She got her start as an associate producer at a local advertising agency, where she honed her skills for transforming ideas into engaging visual experiences. Eager for a more hands-on role in bringing clients‚Äô big ideas to life, Olivia ventured into the world of events and catering ‚Äì a move that led her to become a Sales & Event Manager at the Charles River Boat Company. Off the clock, Olivia swaps her¬†event-planning hat for a bartender‚Äôs apron at Lamplighter Brewing, where she recommends brews with the same passion and precision¬†she brings to every project. When she‚Äôs not pouring beers or orchestrating memorable occasions, she can be found checking off the next restaurant from her endless list,¬†indulging in her latest craft project, or enjoying quality time with family and friends. Connor Richards Sales & Event Coordinator Connor grew up in Annapolis, Maryland, where being around boats and the water was a part of everyday life. He attended Salisbury University, where he discovered his passion for the events industry through a variety of roles, including managing a band, working at the campus radio station, and organizing concerts. Connor‚Äôs favorite part of working in events is the energy and excitement of bringing everything together and the fast-paced, ever-changing nature of the industry. Outside of work, Connor enjoys staying active, spending time with friends, and catching live music whenever he can. Sarah Casseres Sales & Event Coordinator Sarah began her professional journey at The Culinary Institute¬†of America where she studied¬†baking and pastry arts and developed a deep appreciation¬†for creativity and hospitality. After graduation she worked in Napa Valley, immersing herself in the fast-paced world of fine dining. Eventually returning home to the East Coast, she transitioned into the sales and events field, applying her attention to detail with a client-focused approach. Sarah‚Äôs favorite part about events is when all of the moving parts come together¬†to create such a memorable moment! After work and still a foodie at heart, Sarah enjoys trying new restaurants¬†around the city or can be found at the beach or planning her next trip! Meriel Hennessy Sales & Event Coordinator A native of Newton, MA, Meriel grew up spending her summers by and on the ocean in Cape Cod, sparking a lifelong love for the water. After a few years down south, graduating from Clemson University and working in events in Georgia, she returned to Boston in 2023. Though she spent some time working in development and administration, Meriel quickly realized her true passion was in events and customer service ‚Äî nothing beats putting a smile on a customer‚Äôs face! That passion led her to join the team at Charles River Boat Company. Outside of work, you can find Meriel spending time with family and friends, catching a movie, working out (and working part-time) at Orangetheory, or tucked away at a coffee shop, sipping an $8 iced mocha while working toward her M.A. She is thrilled to be part of the CRBC team and excited to help make your dream event a reality! Anne-Marie Smith Tourism Sales Manager Anne-Marie is thrilled to work for the Charles River Boat Company, where she can combine her love of the water, meeting new people, and helping groups create unforgettable memories. With a keen eye for detail and a passion for exceptional service, she ensures every event is a unique experience. When she‚Äôs out of the office, Anne-Marie enjoys traveling and spending quality time with her grown children whenever possible. She is a Montreal native, fluent in both English and French, adding a valuable international perspective to the team. Operations Team Ben Koopman Operations Manager A Marblehead, MA native, Ben grew up on the water‚Äîlobstering, fishing, and cruising the North Shore from an early age. After graduating from Holy Cross, Ben spent eight years in cybersecurity sales, honing his skills in communication, leadership, and operations before returning to his maritime roots as a licensed Captain and member of the Operations Team. As part of this family-run company, Ben works closely with his wife, Cecily, and brother-in-law, Gibson, contributing to a strong, collaborative team dynamic both on and off the dock. In his free time, he enjoys offshore Bluefin tuna fishing, skiing, and spending time outdoors year-round. Sean McKenna Boston Harbor Fleet Manager Sean joined the Charles River Boat Company in 2019 as a Captain. Sean grew up on his family boat that they dock in Salem, MA. He earned his Captain license at the age of 18, eager to join his dad in driving boats in Boston Harbor. He holds a Bachelor of Science in Marine Science from Eckerd College. In his spare time, he teaches a high school fellowship class that encourages young adults to pursue careers in marine and environmental sciences. Sean‚Äôs favorite boat is the Charles I because he married his wife Elizabeth aboard this boat on the 4th of July under the Boston fireworks show. Sean and Elizabeth have a cat named Max. Rob Pierce Charles River Fleet Manager Rob‚Äôs love for the water began after attending a summer camp where he learned to sail a Sunfish and later joined his high school sailing team. After graduating from the Massachusetts Maritime Academy, he spent a decade at sea as a Merchant Mariner, traveling through the western Pacific Ocean and visiting over 50 countries in his career. In 2023, he joined the Charles River Boat Company, seeking a career closer to home. His favorite boat is the Henry Longfellow. In his spare time, Rob enjoys sketching, training in martial arts, and taking his dog Chewy on long walks. Allison Crowley Events Operations Manager Allison graduated from Endicott College in 2020 with her Bachelors in Marketing Communication. During her studies, Allison worked in restaurants and the hospitality industry where she got her first taste of working different styles of events in high volume, fast paced environments. After a few years working in Public Relations, Allison found herself vying for a more hands-on, active role that brought back interpersonal relationships. She joined Charles River Boat Company in April 2023 and it quickly became a perfect fit! Allison thrives working out on the water during events, making sure all details are in place and building new relationships with guests, even if it is just for a brief evening. In her free time, she can be found at the beach, fun restaurants with friends or racing on the go-kart track! Sam Trottenberg Charles River Fleet Captain Sam graduated from Boston University with a degree in Journalism in 2023, but starting in 2021 he always spent his summers working as a Charles River Boat Company tour guide. He‚Äôs loved the water since he attended a New York City sailing school as a child. Sam‚Äôs favorite part of working at CRBC is the incredible¬†team¬†of people he gets to spend his days with. His favorite boat is the Henry Longfellow because it‚Äôs fast. Outside of work, Sam is a performing musician, a writer, a photographer, and a filmmaker.
